section_title: Primary Partial Hip Arthroplasty (Evidence: pg no: 24, L852)
names: Primary Partial Hip Arthroplasty (Evidence: pg no: 24, L852)
Partial hip arthroplasty (Evidence: pg no: 24, L853)
description: Partial hip arthroplasty (unipolar, bipolar, hemi-) is considered medically necessary for ANY of the following indications. (Evidence: pg no: 24, L853-L854)
scope: This guideline addresses hip arthroplasty when performed as an elective, non-emergent procedure and not as part of the care of an acute fracture (excluding fracture of implant and periprosthetic fracture). (Evidence: pg no: 22, L756-L757)

documentation: Femoral neck fracture not amenable to internal fixation or total hip arthroplasty, or previous fixation failed (Evidence: pg no: 24, L855-L856)

exclusions: Indications for partial hip arthroplasty other than those addressed in this guideline are considered not medically necessary (Evidence: pg no: 26, L937-L938)

codes.description: Hemiarthroplasty, hip, partial (eg, femoral stem prosthesis, bipolar arthroplasty) (Evidence: pg no: 27, L972)
